title: What now for peak oil? Unpacking a surprise twist in the fossil fuel feud
summary: In a sharp shift in tone, the latest outlook from the world’s top energy agency signals that oil demand could keep growing through to 2050.

title: European Comics Are the Next Big-Screen Gold Mine
summary: While Hollywood’s superheroes show signs of fatigue, the Franco-Belgian comic scene is thriving — brimming with lush, literate stories that beg to be adapted for film and streaming.

title: Libya Ships First-Ever Cargo From Long-Stalled Chadar Oil Field
summary: Libyan company Zallaf Oil and Gas has shipped the first export cargo from the Chadar oil field, at 600,000 barrels. title: TotalEnergies Could Sell Wind and Solar Assets to Reduce Debt
summary: French Big Oil major TotalEnergies is considering a divestment from some wind and solar power assets in Asia to reduce its debt load, Bloomberg reported today, citing unnamed sources. A potential sale could fetch several hundred million dollars, the sources told the publication. TotalEnergies is cu…

title: Energy Majors Warn EU Climate Push Could Gut Supply Security
summary: The European Union is putting its energy security at risk by attempting to regulate every single molecule of energy products it will import in 2027, the year in which the EU will ban Russian natural gas. title: Big Oil’s Billion-Dollar Bet on the Caspian Is Paying Off
summary: To identify the regions generating the most cash for majors, we forecast the group’s top five projects by cumulative free cash flow for the period 2025 to 2030. title: Oil major Chevron shifts focus to prioritise profits over production
summary: Business plan unveiled at investor day emphasises need to cut costs and lower capital expenditure

title: Oil and gas demand to rise for 25 years without global change of course, says IEA
summary: International energy watchdog sets out new scenario to reflect fading commitment to climate change
